    • Method Detail

      • consistentNow

        public void consistentNow(IChangeAwareMondixInstance mondixInstance)
        Description copied from interface: IConsistencyCallback
        This callback is called when the given indexer is in a consistent state.

        Guarantees:

        • At callback time, all queries of the mondix instance return mutually consistent results.
        • Between the current consistency callback and the previous one (if any), all IChangeCallback listeners of all live queries have been delivered a set of change notifications that is equivalent to the delta between the current consistent state and the previous one.
        • If the model has changed since the previous consistency callback in a way to influence the result of any open ILiveQueryInstance with IChangeCallback listeners attached, this consistency callback is guaranteed to be called eventually.
        • Changing the model is permitted during this callback, though it may lead to an inconsistent state again.
        TODO: deliver a version/revision number, e.g. a monotonously increasing sequence ID of the consistency point?
        Specified by:
        consistentNow in interface IConsistencyCallback

      • getNumberOfCallbacks

        public int getNumberOfCallbacks()
